meanings.definition: A person who is learning a trade or craft from a skilled employer, having agreed to work for a fixed period at low wages.
meanings.sent1: The young apprentice eagerly learned the art of woodworking.
meanings.sent2: She became an apprentice to the blacksmith to learn the trade.
meanings.sent3: The apprentice tried to hammer a nail but ended up hitting his thumb.
meanings.sent4: Becoming an apprentice is like planting a seed of knowledge that will grow over time.
meanings.sent5: The apprentice's hands were calloused from hours of practice.

meanings.definition: To bind (an apprentice) by contract to serve an employer.
meanings.sent1: The master craftsman apprenticed the young boy to learn the art of pottery.
meanings.sent2: He apprenticed his son to the tailor to continue the family tradition.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous apprentice tried to sneak out of his contract but was caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: Being apprenticed to a skilled mentor is like being guided by a wise wizard.
meanings.sent5: The apprentice was officially apprenticed to the renowned artist for a year.

meanings.sent1: She apprenticed under the watchful eye of the master baker.
meanings.sent2: He apprenticed at the shipyard to learn the secrets of shipbuilding.
meanings.sent3: The apprentice accidentally spilled flour everywhere, creating a cloud of white dust.
meanings.sent4: In life, we are all apprenticed to different experiences that shape us.
meanings.sent5: The young girl was excited to apprentice with the famous chef.
